page.title: 01THE SOUTH DOWNS
page.content: The principal natural feature of the area is the South Downs. They provide an important recreational area for walkers and horseriders and motor cars are also allowed limited access. The path along the chalk ridge is designated as a long distance path and is known as the South Downs Way. It extends from Beachy Head in the East to South Harting in the West. The Downs are extensively farmed and arable use has given way to grazing. Sheep, once a familiar part of the scene, are now grazed on the lower slopes. Views from the Downs are spectacular with the North Downs visible on a clear day. The area in between is known as the Weald, once heavily wooded and supporting an iron industry.
